intro: Nauclea sinensis, commonly known as Chinese nauclea, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Nauclea sinensis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. It has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
